title: US CPI Rises 3.4% in November, Exceeding Expectations; Fed Swaps Push First Rate Cut to Late 2026
content: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) accelerated for a second consecutive month, driven by shelter and energy costs. Core services ex-housing remains sticky. Market probability of a January rate cut plummeted to 12% from 60% last week.

title: CloudStrike (CRWD) Q3 Revenue Beats Estimates on AI Security Demand, Shares Tumble 8% After-Hours on Weak Guidance
content: While Q3 EPS of $0.95 beat the street view of $0.88, the cybersecurity firm forecasted Q4 revenue below consensus, citing elongated sales cycles in the enterprise sector and budget tightening in Europe.

title: Beijing Restricts Exports of Gallium and Germanium, Key Materials for Semiconductor Manufacturing, Effective Immediately
content: The Ministry of Commerce cited national security for the new controls. This move is seen as a direct countermeasure to recent US-led chip equipment bans. European chipmakers warn of potential supply chain disruptions within weeks.

title: EU Commission Opens Formal Antitrust Investigation into BioPharma Giant's Acquisition of Rare Disease Startup
content: Regulators are concerned the $15B deal could stifle innovation in gene therapies. The FTC has also signaled it will join the probe, marking a rare cross-Atlantic regulatory alignment against pharma consolidation.

title: Global EV Market: Leading Automakers Announce New Round of Price Cuts in China as Inventory Levels Hit Record Highs
content: Following Tesla's lead, three major domestic manufacturers slashed prices by an average of 5% this morning. Analysts warn this "race to the bottom" will severely compress gross margins across the sector in Q1 2026.
